messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:28): FWIW Opera doesn't have a concept of force-reload exposed in the UI
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (20:34): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, a table i can't quite remember. what would it be a table of?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:40): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: If you are asking the question I think you are asking, DOM Method and behaviour with null
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (20:42): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, yeah I did test a bunch of methods and put the results somewhere...

a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (20:46): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, i found this http://mcc.id.au/2007/05/binding-tests/index.html but i don't think that's what you're after. (there's one test in there for assigning null to some attributes but it looks like i don't have the results recorded.)
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (20:48): for DOMStrings and the specs, at least, there are these: http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/WebIDL/dom/
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (20:49): s/the specs/the DOM specs/
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:11): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, it's not at all clear to me whether any browsers are interested in an innerText or Selection.toString() spec.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:14): Maybe WebKit is, I've gotten no feedback from anyone there yet one way or another.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:14): Well, anyway, I'll keep discussing it, but I'll take a look at createContextualFragment() now.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:16): Is there something wrong with http://html5.org/specs/dom-parsing.html#dom-range-createcontextualfragment ?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: we intend to keep those features and it would be nice to have a spec
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:18): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, I'd appreciate feedback from WebKit people about whether they think the approach I'm using so far for the spec is correct.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:19): I suspect that it's very different from the way WebKit currently implements it, but I'm not sure.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:19): (more particularly, I want to know if WebKit would be willing to implement that approach, not just if they think it's correct)

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:20): Does anyone know of cases where the exact implementation of these features actually affects interop?  Opera seems to get by with innerText behaving mostly like textContent.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:21): I guess this depends on IE's implementation: view-source:http://beihai.gov.cn/5863/2010_4_28/5863_98289_1272423962000.html?open=1
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:22): It has extra whitespace in WebKit and Opera, because apparently (?) IE gets rid of nbsp's or something.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:22): Anyway, I'd prefer to have at least two browsers say they're interested in implementing a spec something along the lines of what I'm writing before I continue, because otherwise it seems somewhat pointless.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:25): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, did you tell me to spec createContextualFragment() because you know that http://html5.org/specs/dom-parsing.html#dom-range-createcontextualfragment is wrong or because you didn't know it exists?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:25): (I could still write tests, of course)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:27): starts reading up on execCommand()
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:34): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: wasn't aware it was complete
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:34): I don't know, is it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:34): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: dunno. we still need tests either way, so i guess use the tests to find out :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:35): the algorithm definitely needs _some_ work, since "the context object's start's node" doesn't make any sense
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:35): but it might just be editorial work
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:35): Why doesn't that make any sense?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:35): Follow the links, it's pretty straightforward.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:36): "start" isn't a noun that applies to objects, for one, and "start" xrefs to nothing, for two
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:36): It xrefs to http://html5.org/specs/dom-range.html#concept-range-start
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:36): It's a noun that applies to Ranges.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:36): hm, i wonder why that didn't work before

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:36): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3, I thought you once tried figuring out for which DOMString attributes null become "null" vs "" vs actually null mapped across various browsers
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:36): It's an inter-spec xref.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:36): oh, it's a link to another document and the doc was still loading
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:36): ok
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:37): xspec xref
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:37): ok i guess it's fine, never mind me :-)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:38): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3, I think Gecko is pretty consistently doing null -> "" and undefined -> "undefined"
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (21:38): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, I likely did some testing like that, but I can't seem to find anything written down with results...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:38): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3, I'd like Opera to match, but I was wondering if there is some known exception list somewhere
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:38): hmm, I guess we'd have to do the research then
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (21:38): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, sorry about that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:39): no worries, now I need not go looking for it :)
